event.title: controlled the region for over 200 years

data.event: A trading post was established by the Portuguese as part of their East African coastal territory and controlled the region for over 200 years between 1500-1700.

event.title: gained control of the settlement by mid 1700

data.event: The Sultanate of Oman battled the Portuguese and gained control of the settlement by mid 1700 along with Mombasa, Pemba Island and Kilwa Kisiwani.

event.title: continued to be a prosperous trading hub for slaves with the Arab world up until 1873

data.event: Tanga continued to be a prosperous trading hub for slaves with the Arab world up until 1873 when the European powers abolished the slave trade.
